## Texts

Gelman, A., Carlin, J. B., Stern, H. S., Dunson, D. B., Vehtari, A., and Rubin, D. B. (2013). *Bayesian Data Analysis*.

Gill, J. (2008). *Bayesian methods : a social and behavioral sciences approach*.

Jackman, S. (2009). *Bayesian analysis for the social sciences*.

Kruschke, J. *Doing Bayesian Data Analysis*. Very intro book, but might be good for those not too confident in statistics generally speaking. And who doesn't like puppies? Second edition has Stan examples. (intro)

Lunn, D., Jackson, C., Best, N., Thomas, A., and Spiegelhalter, D. (2012). *The BUGS Book: A Practical Introduction to Bayesian Analysis*.

Lynch, S. M. (2007). *Introduction to applied Bayesian statistics and estimation for social scientists*.

McElreath, R. *Statistical Rethinking*.  A good modeling book in general, by one who has contributed a lot to helping others learn Stan.  Comes with its own R package too. (intro to moderate)
